DataElement.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Screening Evaluation Past Year Health Care Visit Screening Evaluation Health Care Provider Recommendation Test Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text name of the diagnostic screening test documented in the medical record as recommended to diagnose a patient with colorectal carcinoma. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Screening Evaluation Past Year Health Care Visit Screening Evaluation Health Care Provider Recommendation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes documentation of a visit within the past calendar year for symptoms of colorectal cancer, such as change in bowel habits or rectal bleeding. Concepts.definition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.
A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.

Digital rectal examination.  An examination in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to feel for abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: An examination that checks for abnormalities of organs or other structures in the pelvis and lower abdomen. During a digital rectal exam, a health professional inserts a lubricated, gloved finger of one hand into the rectum and may use the other hand to press on the lower abdomen or pelvic area.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past year (using today
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past year (using today's date to determine time frame) does the chart document whether the provider has recommended any of the following screening tests to this patient?
